demographics.diagnosis: Open surgical wound on left buttock (present on admission); History of chronic wounds

case_header.outcome: Discharged Home with HHA and Healing Partners Plus

clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: Transition from IV to oral antibiotics; Wound healed to 'manageable size'; Clearance by Infectious Disease
clinical_barriers: History of chronic wound healing delays
Requirement for IV antibiotic course completion and subsequent cultures

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Not specifically noted, though family support/competence was the primary focus for safety
bureaucratic_steps: Infectious Disease clearance for home discharge
Verification of family/fiancé wound care competence (Dressing changes)
Coordination of non-overlapping schedules between Centers Home Care and Healing Partners Plus
Securing prior authorizations for specific medications to prevent discharge delays

timeline_deltas.context: Previous PN left abruptly; Melissa took over 27 facilities in November, discovering the patient already 90 days into her stay with a 'loss of connection'.
Total stay reached 101 days primarily due to the 'significant' size of the surgical wound and history of chronic wounds.
Coordination required to ensure HHA and Healing Partners did not visit on the same day to avoid Medicare billing denials.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Intensive phone outreach to SW and patient; Hub monitoring
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Re-established rapport after previous PN's abrupt departure; secured service buy-in.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Coordinated with SW on final DME/Medication logistics and HHA handoff
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Patient discharged on 12/16/25 (Day 101) with all supports in place.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: In-person family training for dressing changes
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Fiancé became competent in care, reducing reliance on intermittent HHA visits.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Regional Director coordinated schedules to ensure no overlapping visit days
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Prevents 'double-dipping' insurance issues where one entity would not get paid by Medicare.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Immediate 'Hub' audit and outreach to facility Social Workers
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Identified 'lost' patients like Case 2 who were nearing discharge without Healing Partners integration.

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Passive observation; deferring entirely to SW/Infectious Disease findings
Relied on SW to handle all ordering without independent audit of delivery dates

unscripted_chaos_signals: Abrupt PN staff turnover in Syracuse region
Extreme geographical distance (4.5-hour drive) preventing face-to-face visits
Insurance 'Double-Dipping' billing restrictions for same-day wound care
